name: ForwardRateAgreement
definition: agreement to exchange an interest rate commitment on a notional amount
explanatoryNote: The FRA determines the rates to be used along with the termination date and notional value. FRAs are cash-settled with the payment based on the net difference between the interest rate of the contract and the floating rate in the market called the reference rate. The notional amount is not exchanged, but rather a cash amount based on the rate differentials and the notional value of the contract.
label: forward rate agreement

name: InterestRateDerivativeInstrument
definition: rate-based derivative whose underlier is an interest rate
label: interest rate derivative instrument

name: InterestRateObservable
label: interest rate observable
definition: rate-based observable that is an interest rate, typically a well-known reference interest rate

name: RateBasedObservable
label: rate-based observable
definition: non-physical observable value, such as an interest rate, market rate, economic indicator, statistical measure calculated over some collection of indices, or some other rate that is readily observable in the world
explanatoryNote: Rate-based observables interest rates, market rate, economic indicators, statistical measure calculated over some collection of indices, foreign exchange rates and others that are readily observable in the world

name: RateBasedDerivativeInstrument
definition: derivative instrument whose underlier is a non-physical observable rate
label: rate-based derivative instrument

name: EconomicRateObservable
label: economic rate observable
definition: rate-based observable that is specifically an economic indicator

name: EconomicRateBasedDerivativeInstrument
label: economic rate-based derivative instrument
definition: rate-based derivative whose underlier is an economic indicator
